snippet: More than 5,000 years ago, nomadic shepherds in Central Asia used imported grain from China and elsewhere, perhaps in funeral rituals, a new study has found.
abstract: Dr Michael Frachetti study in journal Proceedings of the Royal Society B suggests that nomadic shepherds in high plains of Central Asia used grain imported from China and southwestern Asia more than 5,000 years ago, perhaps to sprinkle over bodies in funeral rituals.
lead_paragraph: More than 5,000 years ago, nomadic shepherds in Central Asia used imported grain from China and elsewhere, perhaps in funeral rituals, a new study has found.

headline.main: Before the Silk Road, the Grain Road
headline.print_headline: Archeology: Before the Silk Road, the Grain Road

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the Royal Society B (Journal)
